text: This article contains the list of candidates associated with the 1991 Russian presidential election. ==Registered candidates== {| class="wikitable" ! !colspan=2|Presidential candidate !colspan=2|Vice Presidential candidate !Party !Campaign |- | style="background-color:;" | | 175x175px | Vadim Bakatin |175x175px |Ramazan Abdulatipov | Independent |(campaign) |- | style="background-color:;" | | 175x175px | Boris Yeltsin |175x175px |Alexander Rutskoy | Independent |(campaign) |- | style="background-color:;" | | 175x175px | Vladimir Zhirinovsky |175x105px |Andrey Zavidiya | Liberal Democratic Party |(campaign) |- | style="background-color:;" | | 175x175px | Albert Makashov |175x105px |Alexey Sergeyev | Independent | (campaign) |- | style="background-color:;" | | 175x175px | Nikolai Ryzhkov |175x175px |Boris Gromov | Communist Party |(campaign) |- | style="background-color:;" | | 175x175px | Aman Tuleyev |175x175px |Viktor Bocharov | Independent | (campaign) |} ==Candidates that failed to register== *Boris Gromov -military veteran; ended his campaign and was instead registered as Ryzhkov's (who was nominated by the Communist Party of the Soviet Union) vice-presidential candidate *Roman Kalinin -co-head of the Moscow Gay & Lesbian Alliance *V. Potemkin (nominated by League of Independent Scientists of the RSFSR) *Aleksei Alekseyevich Sergeyev (nominated by Communists of Russia and the Initiative Congress of Russian Communists) -ended his campaign and was instead registered as Makashov's vice-presidential candidate *Lev Ubozhko *Vladimir Voronin -Minister of Internal Affairs (1988-1990) ==Possible candidates who did not run== *Ivan Polozkov -head of the Communist Party of the Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic ==References== 1991 Category:1991 Russian presidential election
title: Candidates in the 1991 Russian presidential election
